column2: WASHINGTON DMV TEST
column4: Washington
column6: WA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column4: Both.
column6: You.

column2: 2. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.
column6: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.
column8: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.

column2: 3. Blind spots are:
column4: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column6: lanes reserved for U-turns.
column8: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column10: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.

column2: 4. At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
column4: before the traffic light turns red.
column6: before you enter the crosswalk.

column2: 5. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column4: yield to other pedestrians.
column6: go back and wait the “WALK” light

column2: 6. To turn right at an intersection with a steady red light, you should:
column4: signal and wait until the light turns green.
column6: slow down and look for traffic before turning.
column8: stop, signal, then turn if it is safe to do so and there’s no sign prohibiting the turn on red.
column10: wait until you have a green turn arrow.

column2: 7. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: not check behind you through your mirrors.
column6: use only one hand on the wheel.
column10: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.

column2: 8. Yellow traffic signs:
column4: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column6: give directional information.

column2: 9. What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
column4: Only right turns are allowed.
column6: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column8: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

column2: 10. Green and white signs:
column4: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.
column6: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.
column10: give information about directions and distances.

column2: 11. Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?
column4: Round
column6: Pentagon

column2: 12. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
column4: Regulation signs (regulatory signs)
column6: Destination signs (guide signs)

column2: 13. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column4: Maintain the correct speed.
column6: Keep your vehicle in good condition.
column8: Do not drive if you are very weary.

column2: 14. Regulatory signs are:
column4: Suggestions
column6: Law

column2: 15. What does this sign indicate?
column4: Train intersection
column6: Parallel railroad crossing (crossroad)

column2: 16. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column6: Pull the steering wheel back.
column8: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column10: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 17. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.
column6: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
column8: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.
column10: You are driving in the wrong direction. Make a U-turn as soon as possible.

column2: 18. The yield sign means:
column4: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.
column6: The traffic light will soon be red.
column8: Drive with caution in wet weather.
column10: You must come to a complete stop.

column2: 19. Drivers entering an intersection to turn left:
column4: must wait for the green arrow before turning left.
column6: can wait in the intersection until they can get through it.
column8: can wait in the intersection until they can turn left.
column10: must not enter the intersection unless they can get through it without having to stop.

column2: 20. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column4: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.
column6: only if the traffic signal turns red.

column2: 21. Alcohol:
column4: makes it difficult for drivers to judge their condition.
column6: increases reaction time.
column8: makes drivers more prone to take chances.

column2: 22. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column6: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column8: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column10: another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 23. This sign means:
column4: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM
column6: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column8: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column2: 24. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column4: of a headlight failure.
column6: that a tire blowout is about to occur.

column2: 25. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.
column6: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.
column8: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column4: Pedestrian crossing ahead
column6: School zone ahead

column2: 27. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: have a beer or two to keep you awake.
column6: find a safe place to stop for a break.
column8: turn on the radio to keep you awake.

column2: 28. Your BAC depends on:
column4: All of the above.
column6: how much alcohol you drink.
column8: how much time passes between drinks.

column2: 29. Which shape is a stop sign?
column4: Diamond
column6: Upside-down triangle

column2: 30. Mature drivers should NOT:
column4: get power steering  when turning the steering wheel gets harder due to age.
column6: drive at all.
column8: listen to loud music while driving.
column10: watch the entire road, from their front bumper to 12 seconds ahead of them.

column2: 31. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column6: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.
column10: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.

column2: 32. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column6: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column8: stop doing what they are doing.
column10: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.

column2: 33. When driving, it is important to keep a space cushion _______ of your vehicle.
column4: only on the left and right side
column6: on all sides

column2: 34. What happens if two vehicles reach at the same time an intersection with four-way stop signs?
column4: Rounabout rules apply.
column6: The first vehicle to reach the intersection must yield.
column8: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left.
column10: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.

column2: 35. The effect that lack of sleep has on your safe driving ability is the same as:
column4: the effect that amphetamines have.
column6: the effect that alcohol has.
column8: the effect that lack of coffee has.
column10: the effect that aggressive driving has.

column2: 36. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: be ready to shift to lower gear.
column6: be ready to brake sharply and stop.
column10: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.

column2: 37. This sign means:
column4: Reversible lane ahead.
column6: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 38. You must use your low beams when you’re within ______ of the vehicle you’re following.
column4: 50 feet
column6: 300 feet

column2: 39. This sign means:
column4: Speeding is not allowed
column6: Traffic signals ahead
column10: You must yield the right-of-way ahead

column2: 40. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
column4: possible hazards on roadways.
column6: dangerous intersections.
